entry.title: On existence of nonformal simply connected symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: Examples of nonformal simply connected symplectic manifolds are constructed.

entry.title: Fukaya category with curves of higher genus
entry.summary: We introduce a formalism which allows us to formulate a version of Fukaya category in presence of curves of higher genus.

entry.title: Connections under Symplectic Reduction
entry.summary: In this note we give conditions which ensure the reduction of a symplectic connection in the process of a Marsden-Weinstein reduction and of the reduction of a presymplectic manifold.

entry.title: Holomorphic Disks and the Chord Conjecture
entry.summary: We prove (a weak version of) Arnold's Chord Conjecture using Gromov's ``classical'' idea in to produce holomorphic disks with boundary on a Lagrangian submanifold.

entry.title: On Stein fillings of the 3-torus T^3
entry.summary: We determine topological properties of Stein domains with boundary diffeomorphic to T^3, S^1\times S^2 and some Seifert fibered 3-manifolds.

entry.title: Marsden-Weinstein reduction for symplectic connections
entry.summary: We propose a reduction procedure for symplectic connections with symmetry. This is applied to coadjoint orbits whose isotropy is reductive.

entry.title: Codimension one symplectic foliations
entry.summary: We define the concept of symplectic foliation on a symplectic manifold and provide a method of constructing many examples, by using asymptotically holomorphic techniques.

entry.title: An extension theorem in symplectic geometry
entry.summary: We extend the ``Extension after Restriction Principle'' for symplectic embeddings of bounded starlike domains to a large class of symplectic embeddings of unbounded starlike domains.

entry.title: Vertical Cohomologies and Their Application to Completely Integrable Hamiltonian Systems
entry.summary: Some functorial and topological properties of vertical cohomologies and their application to completely integrable Hamiltonian systems are studied.

entry.title: Homotopy groups of K-contact toric manifold
entry.summary: We compute the first and second homotopy groups of a class of contact toric manifolds in terms of the images of the associated moment map.

entry.title: Maximal tori in the symplectomorphism groups of Hirzebruch surfaces
entry.summary: We count the conjugacy classes of maximal tori in the groups of symplectomorphisms of S^2 \times S^2 and of the blow-up of CP^2 at a point.

entry.title: A geometric proof of Conn's linearization theorem for analytic Poisson structures
entry.summary: We give a geometric proof of Conn's linearization theorem for analytic Poisson structures, without using the fast convergence method.

entry.title: Examples for nonequivalence of symplectic capacities
entry.summary: We construct an open bounded star-shaped set in R^4 whose cylindrical capacity is strictly bigger than its proper displacement energy.
entry.arxiv:comment: Shortened, small errors corrected, some details added

entry.title: Recursion operators between degenerate Poisson structures
entry.summary: Two degenerate Poisson structures of the same rank possess a recursion operator if and only if their characteristic distributions coincide.

entry.title: Complexity one Hamiltonian SU(2) and SO(3) actions
entry.summary: We consider compact connected six dimensional symplectic manifolds with Hamiltonian SU(2) or SO(3) actions with cyclic principal stabilizers. We classify such manifolds up to equivariant symplectomorphisms.

entry.title: Legendrian and Transversal Knots
entry.summary: This is a survey paper on Legendrian and transversal knots for Handbook of Knot Theory.

entry.title: Symplectic Convexity for Orbifolds
entry.summary: We generalize symplectic convexity theorems for Hamiltonian actions with proper momentum maps to symplectic actions on orbifolds with mod-$\Gamma$ proper momentum maps.

entry.title: Symplectic leaves and symplectic ideals
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due a crucial error.

entry.title: Proofs On Arnold Chord Conjecture And Weinstein Conjecture In M\times C
entry.summary: We give new proofs on Arnold Chord Conjecture and Weinstein Conjecture in M\times C which generalizes the previous works.

entry.title: A Proof On Weinstein Conjecture On Cotangent Bundles Of Open Manifold
entry.summary: We give an proof on the Weinstein conjecture on the cotangent bundles of open manifolds. Its proof is based on Gromov's nonlinear Fredholm alternative.

entry.title: A Proof On Arnold Chord Conjecture In Cotangent Bundles
entry.summary: We prove the Arnold chord conjecture on cotangent bundles of open manifold by Gromov's nonlinear Fredholm alternative for $J-$holomorphic curves.

entry.title: Lagrangian isotopies in Stein manifolds
entry.summary: We establish the uniqueness up to Hamiltonian isotopy of the Lagrangian spheres in some four dimensional Stein manifolds.

entry.title: Calculation of Heegard Floer homology for a class of Brieskorn spheres
entry.summary: In this paper we calculate Ozsv\'ath-Szab\'o Floer homology group HF+ for Brieskorn spheres \Sigma(2,2n + 1,4n + 3).

entry.title: Homology of Lagrangian Submanifolds in Cotangent Bundles
entry.summary: In this paper we find new topological restrictions on Lagrangian submanifolds of cotangent bundles of spheres and of Lens spaces.

entry.title: 3-dimensional methods in contact geometry
entry.summary: These are lecture notes on cut-and-paste methods in 3-dimensional contact geometry.

entry.title: A Note On Weinstein's Conjecture
entry.summary: We prove that there exists at least one close orbit in a given contact hypersurface in some symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: Symplectic geography in dimension 8
entry.summary: We show that in dimension 8 the geography of symplectic manifolds does not differ from that of almost complex ones.

entry.title: Finite dimensional approximations for the symplectic vortex equations
entry.summary: We study Furuta's finite dimensional approximations for the flow lines of the Moment action functional for toric symplectic orbifolds and show their relation to Givental's toric map space.

entry.title: Packing symplectic manifolds by hand
entry.summary: We construct explicit maximal symplectic packings of minimal rational and ruled symplectic 4-manifolds by few balls in a very simple way.

entry.title: Fundamental group of Symp(M,w) with no circle action
entry.summary: We show that the fundamental group of Symp(M,w) can be nontrivial for M that does not admit any symplectic circle action.

entry.title: Embedding fillings of contact 3-manifolds
entry.summary: In this survey article we describe different ways of embedding fillings of contact 3-manifolds into closed symplectic 4-manifolds.

entry.title: Vortices on the cylinder
entry.summary: We apply the finite dimensional approximation techniques of Furuta, Kronheimer, and Manolescu to give a new proof of a result of Jaffe and Taubes.

entry.title: Existence of Bogomol'nyi solitons via Floer theory
entry.summary: We use Floer homology to prove existence of solutions of a generalized Abelian Higgs equation introduced by Schroers.

entry.title: Symplectic capacities of domains in C^2
entry.summary: We derive new estimates for the Gromov width of certain domains in C^2.

entry.title: Isotopies of high genus Lagrangian surfaces
entry.summary: We show that all Lagrangian submanifolds of the cotangent bundle of a Riemann surface which are homotopic to the zero section must be smoothly isotopic to the zero section.

entry.title: The Lalonde-McDuff conjecture for nilmanifolds
entry.summary: We prove that any Hamiltonian bundle whose fiber is a nilmanifold c-splits.

entry.title: Quantum Structures for Lagrangian Submanifolds
entry.summary: We discuss various algebraic quantum structures associated to monotone Lagrangian submanifolds and we present a number of applications, computations and examples.

entry.title: Electromagnetic fields from contact forms
entry.summary: In this short note we prove that every contact form on a 3-manifold M induces a solution to Maxwell's equations on M.

entry.title: The Lalonde-McDuff conjecture and the fundamental group
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of the Lalonde-McDuff conjecture for aspherical manifolds.

entry.title: Lagrangian Floer homology of the Clifford torus and real projective space in odd dimensions
entry.summary: The Floer homology of (RP^n,T^n) is calculated, for n odd.

entry.title: Leafwise Coisotropic Intersections
entry.summary: We establish the leafwise intersection property for closed, coisotropic submanifolds in an exact symplectic manifold satisfying natural additional assumptions.

entry.title: Hofer's metric on the space of diameters
entry.summary: The present paper considers Hofer's distance between diameters in the unit disk. We prove that this distance is unbounded and show its relation to Lagrangian intersections.

entry.title: Stability is not open
entry.summary: We give an example of a symplectic manifold with a stable hypersurface such that nearby hypersurfaces are typically unstable.

entry.title: On sums of admissible coadjoint orbits
entry.summary: Given a quasi-Hermitian semisimple Lie algebra, we describe possible spectra of the sum of two admissible elements from its dual vector space.

entry.title: Special lagrangian fibrations on flag variety $F^3$
entry.summary: One constructs lagrangian fibrations on the flag variety $F^3$ and proves that the fibrations are special.

entry.title: Simple examples of distinct Liouville-type symplectic structures
entry.summary: We discuss some examples of open manifolds which admit non-isomorphic symplectic structures of Liouville type.
entry.arxiv:comment: v2: one remark added, minor changes

entry.title: Lagrangian Topology and Enumerative Geometry
entry.summary: We use the "pearl" machinery in our previous work to study certain enumerative invariants associated to monotone Lagrangian submanifolds.

entry.title: Singular polarizations and symplectic embeddings
entry.summary: We prove in this paper that any 4-dimensional symplectic manifold is essentially made of finitely many symplectic ellipsoids. The key tool is a singular analogue of Donaldson's symplectic hypersurfaces in irrational symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: Symplectic rigidity and weak commutativity
entry.summary: An alternative proof of Eliashberg-Gromov's C^0-rigidity theorem is presented and a new notion of weak Lie brackets for Hamiltonian vector fields is proposed and compared.

entry.title: On a generalization of a theorem of McDuff
entry.summary: We study the symplectic structure of the holomorphic coadjoint orbits, generalizing a theorem of McDuff on the symplectic structure of Hermitian symmetric spaces of noncompact type.

entry.title: Quivers and Poisson structures
entry.summary: We produce natural quadratic Poisson structures on moduli spaces of representations of quivers. In particular, we study a natural Poisson structure for the generalised Kronecker quiver with 3 arrows.

entry.title: Obstruction classes and Open Gromov-Witten invariants
entry.summary: We define genus zero open Gromov-Witten invariants for Calabi-Yau three folds and relatively spin Lagrangian submanifold of Maslov index zero.

entry.title: On the relative slice Thurston-Bennequin inequality
entry.summary: We derive a relative version of the slicing Bennequin inequalities for cobordant Legendrian knots, and review a few proofs of the result.

entry.title: Contact manifolds with symplectomorphic symplectizations
entry.summary: We provide examples of contact manifolds of any odd dimension $\geq 5$ which are not diffeomorphic but have exact symplectomorphic symplectizations.

entry.title: Flexible Weinstein manifolds
entry.summary: This survey on flexible Weinstein manifolds is, essentially, an extract from our recent joint book.

entry.title: Reeb-Thurston stability for symplectic foliations
entry.summary: We prove a version the local Reeb-Thurston stability theorem for symplectic foliations.

entry.title: Symplectic intersections and invariant measures
entry.summary: We detect, by using symplectic topology, invariant measures with large rotation vectors for a class of Hamiltonian flows.

entry.title: Compactly supported Hamiltonian loops with non zero Calabi invariant
entry.summary: We give examples of compactly supported Hamiltonian loops with non zero Calabi invariant on certain open symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: $C^{m_0}$-Smoothness of Evaluation Maps
entry.summary: We give a proof that evaluation map $E: \Sigma^l\times {\cal M}\rightarrow M^l$ is of class $C^{m_0}$.

entry.title: On Bohr-Sommerfeld-Heisenberg Quantization
entry.summary: This paper presents the theory of Bohr-Sommerfeld-Heisenberg quantization of a completely integrable Hamiltonian system in the context of geometric quantization. The theory is illustrated with several examples.

entry.title: Morse homology of manifolds with boundary revisited
entry.summary: This re-certifying paper describes the details of the Morse homology of manifolds with boundary, introduced by the author before, in terms of handlebody decompositions.

entry.title: On Regularity of J-holomorphic Maps
entry.summary: We provide a short proof that an $L^2_1$ and $J$-holomorphic curve is in fact smooth. As an application, we deduce a removal of singularity theorem for curves of finite energy.

entry.title: Geometric Cycles in Floer Theory
entry.summary: We construct a version of Hamiltonian Floer Homology based on the notion of a semi-infinite cycle. As an application, we provide a new proof for the existence of critical points of the action functional.

entry.title: Gromov-Uhlenbeck Compactness
entry.summary: We develop an analytic framework that combines the compactness theory of Gromov for J-holomorphic curves with that of Uhlenbeck for ASD connections. Compactness, regularity and removal of singularity theorems are discussed.

entry.title: Comment on a theorem of Hamilton
entry.summary: This paper gives a slight refinement of a theorem of Hamilton, which shows that the velocity of a Keplerian motion moves on a circle.

entry.title: Poisson-Lie T-duality and Courant algebroids
entry.summary: Poisson-Lie T-duality is explained using the language of Courant algebroids.

entry.title: Darboux normal form theorem as an example of Liouville integrability theorem
entry.summary: The note offers a proof of Darboux and Liouville theorems from a symplectic group action perspective.

entry.title: Cubic Hamiltonians
entry.summary: We determine a precise necessary and sufficient condition for completeness of the Hamiltonian vector field associated to a homogeneous cubic polynomial on a symplectic plane.

entry.title: Cayley-Sylvester invariants and the Hamilton equations
entry.summary: We note implications of the Cayley-Sylvester theory of invariants and covariants for the Hamilton equations generated by cubic and quartic Hamiltonian functions.

entry.title: Symplectic A-directed Immersions
entry.summary: We derive a symplectic analogue of A-directed immersion theorem.

entry.title: Bohr-Sommerfeld-Heisenberg Quantization of the Mathematical Pendulum
entry.summary: In this paper we give the Bohr-Sommerfeld-Heisenberg quantization of the mathematical pendulum.

entry.title: Geometric Equivariant Extension of Sections in GW Theory I
entry.summary: This paper is to explain one of the two constructions in our work [L] on analytic foundation of GW theory. We improve and clarify the results there.

entry.title: Microlocal Category
entry.summary: Given a compact symplectic manifold whose symplectic form has integer periods, one associates to it a dg category based on the microlocal analysis according to Kashiwara-Schapira

entry.title: On Hamiltonian and contact isotopy liftings
entry.summary: We construct counterexamples to lifting properties of Hamiltonian and contact isotopies.

entry.title: The autonomous norm on $Ham(\mathbf{R}^{2n})$ is bounded
entry.summary: We prove that the autonomous norm on the group of compactly supported Hamiltonian diffeomorphisms of the standard $\mathbf{R}^{2n}$ is bounded.

entry.title: Picard groups of b-symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: We compute the Picard group of a stable b-symplectic manifold $M$ by introducing a collection of discrete invariants $\mathfrak{Gr}$ which classify $M$ up to Morita equivalence.

entry.title: Gluing affine vortices
entry.summary: We provide an analytical construction of the gluing map for stable affine vortices over the upper half plane with the Lagrangian boundary condition.

entry.title: J-holomorphic cylinders between ellipsoids in dimension four
entry.summary: We establish results concerning the existence and nonexistence of regular $J$-holomorphic cylinders between nested pairs of ellipsoids in $\mathbb{R}^4$.

entry.title: Smooth nondisplaceability for fixed point sets of involutions
entry.summary: We prove that on closed manifolds of odd Euler characteristic fixed point sets of involutions are smoothly nondisplaceable.

entry.title: Differential spaces in integrable Hamiltonian systems
entry.summary: This paper uses differential spaces to obtain some new results in integrable Hamiltonian systems

entry.title: Higher-degree Smoothness of Perturbations I
entry.summary: In this paper and its sequels, we give an unified treatment of the higher-degree smoothness of admissible perturbations and related results used in the global perturbation method for GW and Floer theories.

entry.title: On nonformal simply connected symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: For any $N \geq 5$ nonformal simply connected symplectic manifolds of dimension $2N$ are constructed. This disproves the formality conjecture for simply connected symplectic manifolds which was introduced by Lupton and Oprea.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, LaTeX; the short announcement see in math.SG/9810065; a revised version

entry.title: Dirac submanifolds of Jacobi manifolds
entry.summary: The notion of a Dirac submanifold of a Poisson manifold was studied by Xu (arXiv:math.SG/0110326). We give an interpretation of Xu's definition in terms of a general notion of tensor fields soldered to a normalized submanifold. Then, this interpretation is used to define Dirac submanifolds of a Jacobi manifold. Several properties and examples are discussed.

entry.title: Existence of relative periodic orbits near relative equilibria
entry.summary: We show existence of relative periodic orbits (a.k.a. relative nonlinear normal modes) near relative equilibria of a symmetric Hamiltonian system under an appropriate assumption on the Hessian of the Hamiltonian. This gives a relative version of the Moser-Weinstein theorem. The paper supersedes an earlier paper (this arxiv math.SG/9906007), which contains a mistake.

entry.title: Covariant Poisson structures on complex Grassmannians
entry.summary: The purpose of this paper is to study covariant Poisson structures on the complex Grassmannian obtained as quotients by coisotropic subgroups of the standard Poisson--Lie SU(n). Properties of Poisson quotients allow to describe Poisson embeddings generalizing those obtained in math.SG/9802082.

entry.title: Middle-dimensional squeezing and non-squeezing behavior of symplectomorphisms
entry.summary: After reformulating Gromov's non-squeezing theorem as an area-inequality, we discuss a seemingly natural higher dimensional generalization.
entry.arxiv:comment: The results of this preprint are contained in the more recent paper "How large is the shadow of a symplectic ball?", arXiv:1202.3614v1 [math.SG], which contains also new results. This older version will not be updated nor submitted to a journal

entry.title: Holomorphic triangles and invariants for smooth four-manifolds
entry.summary: The aim of this article is to introduce invariants of oriented, smooth, closed four-manifolds, built using the Floer homology theories defined in two earlier papers (math.SG/0101206 and math.SG/0105202). This four-dimensional theory also endows the corresponding three-dimensional theories with additional structure: an absolute grading of certain of its Floer homology groups. The cornerstone of these constructions is the study of holomorphic disks in the symmetric products of Riemann surfaces.

entry.title: Connected Components of the Space of Surface Group Representations II
entry.summary: In math.SG/0303255, we discussed the connected components of the space of surface group representations for any compact connected semisimple Lie group and any closed compact (orientable or nonorientable) surface. In this sequel, we generalize the results in math.SG/0303255 in two directions: we consider general compact connected Lie groups, and we consider all compact surfaces, including the ones with boundaries. We also interpret our results in terms of moduli spaces of flat connections over compact surfaces.

entry.title: Standard surfaces and nodal curves in symplectic 4-manifolds
entry.summary: Continuing the program of math.SG/0012067 and math.SG/0310450, we introduce refinements of the Donaldson-Smith standard surface count which are designed to count nodal pseudoholomorphic curves and curves with a prescribed decomposition into reducible components. In cases where a corresponding analogue of the Gromov-Taubes invariant is easy to define, our invariants agree with those analogues. We also prove a vanishing result for some of the invariants that count nodal curves.
entry.arxiv:comment: Technical details needed for the proofs of some results in Section 3 have been added in Section 6. 43 pages

entry.title: Covariant Poisson Structures on Complex Projective Spaces
entry.summary: We show that the standard SU(n)-covariant Poisson sphere $S^{2n-1}$ is embedded in the nonstandard $SU(n+1)$-covariant Poisson complex projective spaces $CP^{n}$.

entry.title: Signature via Novikov numbers
entry.summary: It is shown that the signature of a manifold with a symplectic circle action having only isolated fixed points, equals the alternating sum of the Novikov numbers corresponding to the cohomology class of the generalized moment map. The same is true for more general fixed point sets.

entry.title: A note on generating functions
entry.summary: An afinne-invariant view of generating functions of symplectic transformations of an affine symplectic space is discussed. More generally, it works for symmetric symplectic spaces. The note is completely elementary, but it yields some nice pictures.

entry.title: The structure of a symplectic manifold on the space of loops of 7-manifold
entry.summary: We define a symplectic structure on the space of non parametrized loops in $G_2$ manifold. We also develop some basics of intersection theory of Lagrangian submanifolds.

entry.title: Remarks on the flux groups
entry.summary: I study flux groups of compact symplectic manifolds. Under some topological assumptions, I give a new estimate of the rank of flux groups and give a method of construcion of compact symplectic aspherical manifolds.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, no figures, corrected version to appear in Math.Res.Letters 7(2000)

entry.title: Symmetric symplectic spaces with Ricci-type curvature
entry.summary: We determine the isomorphism classes of symmetric symplectic manifolds of dimension at least 4 which are connected, simply-connected and have a curvature tensor which has only one non-vanishing irreducible component -- the Ricci tensor.

entry.title: Some examples of aspherical symplectic four-manifolds
entry.summary: The paper was withdrawn due to a gap in the proof of Lemma 3.
entry.arxiv:comment: Paper withdrawn due to a gap in the proof of Lemma 3

entry.title: Groupoids and the integration of Lie algebroids
entry.summary: We show that a Lie algebroid on a stratified manifold is integrable if, and only if, its restriction to each strata is integrable. These results allow us to construct a large class of algebras of pseudodifferential operators.

entry.title: A fixed point formula for loop group actions
entry.summary: We express the index of the Dirac operator on symplectic quotients of a Hamiltonian loop group manifold with proper moment map in terms of fixed point data.

entry.title: On Symplectic Cobordisms
entry.summary: In this note we make several observations concerning symplectic cobordisms. Among other things we show that every contact 3-manifold has infinitely many concave symplectic fillings and that all overtwisted contact 3-manifolds are ``symplectic cobordism equivalent.''

entry.title: Fedosov Quantization on Symplectic Ringed Spaces
entry.summary: We expose the basics of the Fedosov quantization procedure, placed in the general framework of symplectic ringed spaces. This framework also includes some Poisson manifolds with non regular Poisson structures, presymplectic manifolds, complex analytic symplectic manifolds, etc.

entry.title: Symplectic Parshin-Arakelov inequality
entry.summary: Lefschetz fibration is the symplectic analogue of stable holomorphic fibration in complex geometry. A 4-dimensional stable holomorphic fibration satisfies the famous Parshin-Arakelov inequality. In this note we present an analogous inequality for a 4-dimensional Lefschetz fibration.

entry.title: Symplectically harmonic cohomology of nilmanifolds
entry.summary: This paper can be considered as an extension to our paper [On symplectically harmonic forms on six-dimensional nilmanifolds, Comment. Math. Helv. 76 (2001), n 1, 89-109]. Also, it contains a brief survey of recent results on symplectically harmonic cohomology.

entry.title: On the Relative Dualising Sheaf of a Symplectic Lefschetz Fibration
entry.summary: This has been withdrawn by the authors.

entry.title: Geodesic flows and contact toric manifolds
entry.summary: These are notes for a course on contact manifolds and torus actions delivered at the summer school on Symplectic Geometry of Integrable Hamiltonian Systems at Centre de Recerca Matem\`atica in Barcelona in July 2001. To be published by Birkhauser.

entry.title: Enumeration of Genus-Two Curves with a Fixed Complex Structure in P^2 and P^3
entry.summary: We express the genus-two fixed-complex-structure enumerative invariants of P^2 and P^3 in terms of the genus-zero enumerative invariants. The approach is to relate each genus-two fixed-complex-structure enumerative invariant to the corresponding symplectic invariant.

entry.title: Enumeration of Genus-Three Plane Curves with a Fixed Complex Structure
entry.summary: We give a practical formula for counting irreducible nodal genus-three plane curves that a fixed generic complex structure on the normalization. As an intermediate step, we enumerate rational plane curves that have a $(3,4)$-cusp.

entry.title: Maximal Hamiltonian tori for polygon spaces
entry.summary: We study the poset of Hamiltonian tori for polygon spaces. We determine some maximal elements and give examples where maximal Hamiltonian tori are not all of the same dimension.

entry.title: A de Rham theorem for symplectic quotients
entry.summary: We introduce a de Rham model for stratified spaces arising from symplectic reduction. It turns out that the reduced symplectic form and its powers give rise to well-defined cohomology classes, even on a singular symplectic quotient.

entry.title: Pseudoholomorphic Strips in Symplectisations II: Fredholm theory and Transversality
entry.summary: See http://www.math.msu.edu/~abbas or Wiley preprint server.

entry.title: Cohomological Splitting of Coadjoint Orbits
entry.summary: The rational cohomology of a coadjoint orbit ${\cal O}$ is expressed as tensor product of the cohomology of other coadjoint orbits ${\cal O}_k$, with $ \hbox{dim} {\cal O}_k< \hbox{dim} {\cal O}$.
entry.arxiv:comment: Minor revision. Version to appear in Archiv der Mathematik

entry.title: Nonstandard Lagrangian Submanifolds in CP^n
entry.summary: We use Hamiltonian actions to construct nonstandard (as opposed to $\RP^n$ and $T^n$) Lagrangian submanifolds of $\CP^n$. First of all, a quotient of $\RP^3$ by the dihedral group $D_3$ is a Lagrangian submanifold of $\CP^3$. Secondly, $\Su(n)/\Z_n$ are Lagrangian submanifolds of $\CP^{n^2-1}$.

entry.title: On the topology of the space of contact structures on torus bundles
entry.summary: We prove the existence of essential loops in the space of contact structures on torus bundles over the circle.

entry.title: Geometry of symplectic intersections
entry.summary: In this paper we survey several intersection and non-intersection phenomena appearing in the realm of symplectic topology. We discuss their implications and finally outline some new relations of the subject to algebraic geometry.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proceedings of the ICM, Beijing 2002, vol. 2, 241--256

entry.title: Contact 3-manifolds with infinitely many Stein fillings
entry.summary: Infinitely many contact 3-manifolds each admitting infinitely many, pairwise non-diffeomorphic Stein fillings are constructed. We use Lefschetz fibrations in our constructions and compute their first homologies to distinguish the fillings.

entry.title: Lectures on four-dimensional Dehn twists
entry.summary: These are notes from the 2003 C.I.M.E. summer school "symplectic 4-manifolds and algebraic surfaces". They cover the same material as the author's (by now ancient) Ph.D. thesis.

entry.title: J-holomorphic Disks and Lagrangian Squeezing
entry.summary: We define an invariant $l(M,W,\omega)$ for Lagrangian submanifold and prove that if the Lagrangian submanifold is embedded in the ball of radius $r_0$, then $l(M,W,\Omega)$ must be smaller than $4\pi t_0^2$. This improves Gromov's Lagrangian embedding theorem.

entry.title: Contact Structures with Distinct Heegaard Floer Invariants
entry.summary: We prove that the contact structures on Y= dX induced by non-homotopic Stein structures on the 4-manifold X have distinct Heegaard Floer invariants.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 7 figures; a minor mistake corrected, an appendix reviewing the Akbulut-Ozbagci construction of Lefschetz fibrations added, references updated

entry.title: Topologically knoted Lagrangians in simply connected four manifolds
entry.summary: Vidussi was the first to construct knotted Lagrangian tori in simply connected four dimensional manifolds. Fintushel and Stern introduced a second way to detect such knotting.This note demonstrates that similar examples may be distinguished by the fundamental group of the exterior.

entry.title: Lagrangian spheres in S^2 x S^2
entry.summary: We prove that all Lagrangian spheres in S^2 x S^2 are Hamiltonian isotopic. The proof uses various properties of holomorphic curves in symplectic manifolds with cylindrical ends which were recently developed in connection with the Symplectic Field Theory.

entry.title: Linearization of Poisson brackets
entry.summary: We review the linearization of Poisson brackets and related problems, in the formal, analytic and smooth categories.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Letters in Math. Phys

entry.title: A refinement of the complex convexity theorem via symplectic techniques
entry.summary: We apply techniques from symplectic geometry to extend and give a new proof of the complex convexity theorem of Gindikin-Kroetz.

entry.title: Normal forms of Poisson structures near a symplectic leaf
entry.summary: We show how one can handle the formalism developped by Yurii Vorobjev in order to give general results about the problems of linearisation and of normal form of a Poisson structure in the neighborhood of one of its symplectic leaves.

entry.title: On equivariant cohomology, integrals of equivariant forms and Duistermaat-Heckman measures for non-compact group actions
entry.summary: This is an expanded version of the talk I gave at Oberwolfach, MIT and several other universities.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, no figures, LaTeX, new section on Duistermaat-Heckman measures added

entry.title: On Heegaard Floer homology of plumbed three-manifolds with b_1=1
entry.summary: In this paper we extend the results of \cite{Plumbing} to calculate Ozsv\'ath-Szab\'o Floer homology group HF+ for a class of negative-semidefinite plumbings with b_1 = 1.

entry.title: Transverse contact structures on Seifert 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We characterize the oriented Seifert-fibered three-manifolds which admit positive, transverse contact structures.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published by Algebraic and Geometric Topology at http://www.maths.warwick.ac.uk/agt/AGTVol4/agt-4-49.abs.html

entry.title: Classification of tight contact structures on small Seifert 3-manifolds with e_0\geq 0
entry.summary: We classify positive, tight contact structures on closed Seifert fibered 3-manifolds with base S^2, three singular fibers and e_0\geq 0.

entry.title: Dual mixed volumes and isosystolic inequalities
entry.summary: The theory of dual mixed volumes is extended to star bodies in cotangent bundles and is used to prove several isosystolic inequalities for Hamiltonian systems and Finsler metrics.

entry.title: On the Alexander polynomials of Hurwitz curves
entry.summary: Properties of the Alexander polynomials of Hurwitz curves are investigated. A complete description of the set of the Alexander polynomials of irreducible Hurwitz curves in the terms of their roots is given.

entry.title: Toric symplectic singular spaces I: isolated singularities
entry.summary: We generalize a theorem of Delzant classifying compact connected symplectic manifolds with completely integrable torus actions to certain singular symplectic spaces. The assumption on singularities is that if they are not finite quotient then they are isolated.

entry.title: On the Lie-formality of Poisson manifolds
entry.summary: Starting from the problem of describing cohomological invariants of Poisson manifolds we prove in a sense a ``no-go'' result: the differential graded Lie algebra of de Rham forms on a smooth Poisson manifold is formal.

entry.title: Schrödinger Equation in Phase Space and Deformation Quantization
entry.summary: We justify the relevance of Torres-Vega Schr\"{o}dinger equation in phase space using Stone-von Neumann's theorem, and relate it to deformation quantization.

entry.title: Symplectic Geometry
entry.summary: This is an overview article on selected topics in symplectic geometry written for the Handbook of Differential Geometry (volume 2, edited by F.J.E. Dillen and L.C.A. Verstraelen).

entry.title: Poisson fiber bundles and coupling Dirac structures
entry.summary: We give sufficient conditions for the existence of a Dirac structure on the total space of a Poisson fiber bundle endowed with a compatible connection. We also show that Cartan and Cartan-Hannay-Berry connections give rise to coupling Dirac structures.

entry.title: Relative Gerbes
entry.summary: This paper introduces the notion of ``relative gerbes'' for smooth maps of manifolds, and discusses their differential geometry. The equivalence classes of relative gerbes are further classified by the relative integral cohomology in degree three.

entry.title: Pre-quantization of Quasi-Hamiltonian Spaces
entry.summary: This paper develops the pre-quantization of Lie group-valued moment maps, and establishes its equivalence with the pre-quantization of infinite-dimensional Hamiltonian loop group spaces.

entry.title: Cluster Homology
entry.summary: We assign, to a Langrangian submanifold $L$, a new homology which manages the bubbling of disks by means of auxiliary Morse data. This invariant of the Hamiltonian isotopy class of $L$ has many applications and naturally leads to a universal Floer theory for Lagrangian intersections.

entry.title: Normal forms of vector fields on Poisson manifolds
entry.summary: We study formal and analytic normal forms of radial and Hamiltonian vector fields on Poisson manifolds near a singular point.

entry.title: Ruled 4-manifolds and isotopies of symplectic surfaces
entry.summary: We study symplectic surfaces in ruled symplectic 4-manifolds which are disjoint from a given symplectic section. As a consequence we see that, in any symplectic 4-manifold, two homologous symplectic surfaces which are sufficiently C^0 close must be Hamiltonian isotopic.

entry.title: Courant brackets on noncommutative algebras and omni-Lie algebras
entry.summary: We define a Courant bracket on an associative algebra using the theory of Hochschild homology, and we introduce the notion of Dirac algebra. We show that the bracket of an omni-Lie algebra is quite a kind of Courant bracket.

entry.title: On fundamental groups of symplectically aspherical manifolds II: abelian groups
entry.summary: We describe all abelian groups which can appear as the fundamental groups of closed symplectically aspherical manifolds. The proofs use the theory of symplectic Lefschetz fibrations.

entry.title: On the Fukaya Categories of Higher Genus Surfaces
entry.summary: We construct the Fukaya category of a closed surface equipped with an area form using only elementary (essentially combinatorial) methods. We also compute the Grothendieck group of its derived category.

entry.title: On the Hermitian curvature of symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: We study the integrability of a (almost) complex structure calibrated by a symplectic form. We find new sufficent conditions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages. To appear in Advances in Geometry

entry.title: New criteria to identify spectrum
entry.summary: In this paper we give some new criteria for identifying the components of a probability measure, in its Lebesgue decomposition. This enables us to give new criteria to identify spectral types of self-adjoint operators on Hilbert spaces, especially those of interest.

entry.title: Big{è}bres quasi-Lie et boucles de Lie
entry.summary: In this work, we define the quasi-Poisson Lie quasigroups, dual objects to the quasi-poisson Lie groups and we establish the correspondance between the local quasi-Poisson Lie quasigroups and quasi-Lie bialgebras (up to isomorphism)

entry.title: Contact structures on 3-manifolds are deformations of foliations
entry.summary: In this note we observe, answering a question of Eliashberg and Thurston, that all contact structures on a closed oriented 3-manifold are $C^\infty$-deformations of foliations.

entry.title: The $ε$ - revised system with three linear controls
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce the $\epsilon$ - revised system associated to a Hamilton - Poisson system. The $\epsilon$ - revised system of the rigid body with three linear controls is defined and some of its geometrical and dynamical properties are investigated.

entry.title: On the modular classes of Poisson-Nijenhuis manifolds
entry.summary: We prove a property of the Poisson-Nijenhuis manifolds which yields new proofs of the bihamiltonian properties of the hierarchy of modular vector fields defined by Damianou and Fernandes.

entry.title: Symplectic rational blow-down along Seifert fibered 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We verify that the rational blow-down schemes along certain Seifert fibered 3-manifolds found by the second author, Szabo and Wahl are, in fact, symplectic operations.

entry.title: A topological theory of Maslov indices for Lagrangian and symplectic paths
entry.summary: We propose a topological theory of the Maslov index for lagrangian and symplectic paths based on a minimal system of axioms. We recover, as particular cases, the Hoermander and the Robbin-Salomon indices.

entry.title: Isolated fixed points and moment maps of symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: Withdrawn due to an incompleteness of the main results.

entry.title: Displacement energy of coisotropic submanifolds and Hofer's geometry
entry.summary: We prove that the displacement energy of a stable coisotropic submanifold is bounded away from zero if the ambient symplectic manifold is closed, rational and satisfies a mild topological condition.

entry.title: On the Weinstein conjecture in higher dimensions
entry.summary: The existence of a "Plastikstufe" for a contact structure implies the Weinstein conjecture for all supporting contact forms.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Commentarii Mathematici Helvetici, Volume 84, Issue 2, 2009, pp. 429-436

entry.title: Py-Calabi quasi-morphisms and quasi-states on orientable surfaces of higher genus
entry.summary: We show that Py-Calabi quasi-morphism on the group of Hamiltonian diffeomorphisms of surfaces of higher genus gives rise to a quasi-state.
entry.arxiv:comment: MSc thesis, Tel Aviv University (Israel), January 2007, 38 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: On families of $BS_{can}$ lagrangian tori in projective spaces
entry.summary: This small note contains two simple remarks about Bohr - Sommerfeld with respect to the anticanonical class lagrangian tori in the projective spaces, which are the most popular examples of monotone symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: Natural Frobenius Submanifolds
entry.summary: I.A.B. Strachan introduced the notion of a natural Frobenius submanifold of a Frobenius manifold and gave a sufficient but not necessary condition for a submanifold to be a natural Frobenius submanifold. This paper will give a necessary and sufficient condition and classify the natural Frobenius hypersurfaces.

entry.title: On the existence of tight contact structures on Seifert fibered 3-manifolds
entry.summary: We determine the closed, oriented Seifert fibered 3-manifolds which carry positive tight contact structures. Our main tool is a new non-vanishing criterion for the contact Ozsvath-Szabo invariant.

entry.title: Lecture Notes on Equivariant Cohomology
entry.summary: These are the lecture notes for the introductory graduate course I taught at Yale during Spring 2007. I mostly followed [GS], [BGV], [AB], [Par2], and there are no original results in these notes.

entry.title: Reflected BSDE with quadratic growth and unbounded terminal value
entry.summary: In this paper we prove the existence of a solution for reflected BSDE's\ whose coefficient is of quadratic growth in $z$ and of linear growth in $y$, with an unbounded terminal value.

entry.title: Homogeneous quasimorphisms on the symplectic linear group
entry.summary: In this note, we show a uniqueness result of homogeneous quasimorphisms defined on the universal cover of the symplectic linear group.

entry.title: Fundamentals for Symplectic $\mathcal{A}$-modules
entry.summary: Sheaf theoretically based Abstract Differential Geometry incorporates and generalizes all the classical differential geometry. Here, we undertake to partially explore the implications of Abstract Differential Geometry to classical symplectic geometry. The full investigation will be presented elsewhere.

entry.title: A Brunn-Minkowski Inequality for Symplectic Capacities of Convex Domains
entry.summary: In this work we prove a Brunn-Minkowski-type inequality in the context of symplectic geometry and discuss some of its applications.

entry.title: A note on Stein fillings of contact manifolds
entry.summary: In this note we construct infinitely many distinct simply connected Stein fillings of a certain infinite family of contact 3--manifolds.

entry.title: On the capacity of Lagrangians in the cotangent disc bundle of the torus
entry.summary: The paper is wihdrawn due to a critical error in the argument using the spectral sequence
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. 18 pages

entry.title: Construction and Uniqueness for reflected BSDE under linear increasing condition
entry.summary: In this paper, we study the uniqueness of the solution of reflected BSDE with one or two barriers, under continuous and linear increasing condition of generator $g$. Before that we study the construction of solution of of reflected BSDE with one or two barriers.

entry.title: Positive divisors in symplectic geometry
entry.summary: In this paper, we gave some explicit relations between absolute and relative Gromov-Witten invariants. We proved that a symplectic manifold is symplectic rationally connected if it contains a positive divisor symplectomorphic to $P^n$.

entry.title: Symplectic Dirac Operators on Hermitian Symmetric Spaces
entry.summary: We describe the shape of the symplectic Dirac operators on Hermitian symmetric spaces. For this, we consider these operators as families of operators that can be handled more easily than the original ones.

entry.title: Continuous families of Hamiltonian torus actions
entry.summary: We determine conditions under which two Hamiltonian torus actions on a symplectic manifold $M$ are homotopic by a family of Hamiltonian torus actions, when $M$ is a toric manifold and when $M$ is a coadjoint orbit.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 pages, 1 figure. To appear in J. Geom. Phys

entry.title: On the degenerated Arnold-Givental conjecture
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by author due to an error in the proof.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by author due to an error in the proof

entry.title: Hypercontact structures and Floer homology
entry.summary: We introduce a new Floer theory associated to a pair consisting of a Cartan hypercontact 3-manifold M and a hyperkaehler manifold X.

entry.title: Curves without automorphisms and integral invariants of Calabi-Yau three-folds
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due a crucial mistake in proof of lemma 4.2.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due a crucial mistake in proof of lemma 4.2

entry.title: Hamiltonian monodromy via geometric quantization and theta functions
entry.summary: In this paper, Hamiltonian monodromy is studied from the point of view of geometric quantization abd theta functions, and various differential geometric aspects thereof are dealt with, all related to holonomies of suitable flat connections.

entry.title: Seidel-Smith Cohomology for Tangles
entry.summary: We generalize the "symplectic Khovanov cohomology" of Seidel and Smith to tangles using the notion of symplectic valued topological field theory introduced by Wehrheim and Woodward.

entry.title: Symplectic fillings of links of quotient surface singularities
entry.summary: We study symplectic deformation types of minimal symplectic fillings of links of quotient surface singularities. In particular, there are only finitely many symplectic deformation types for each quotient surface singularity.

entry.title: On the flux of pseudo-Anosov homeomorphisms
entry.summary: We exhibit a pseudo-Anosov homeomorphism of a surface S which acts trivially on the first homology group of S and whose flux is non zero

entry.title: Perturbed Floer Homology of some fibered three manifolds
entry.summary: In this paper, we write down a special Heegaard diagram for a given product three manifold $\Sigma_g\times S^1$. We use the diagram to compute its perturbed Heegaard Floer homology.

entry.title: Existence and stability of foliations by J-holomorphic spheres
entry.summary: We study the existence and stability of holomorphic foliations in dimension greater than 4 under perturbations of the underlying almost complex structure. An example is given to show that, unlike in dimension 4, J-holomorphic foliations are not stable under large perturbations of almost complex structure.

entry.title: Stability of closed characteristics on compact hypersurfaces in $\R^{2n}$ under pinching condition
entry.summary: In this article, let $\Sigma\subset\R^{2n}$ be a compact convex hypersurface which is $(r, R)$-pinched with $\frac{R}{r}<\sqrt{{3/2}}$. Then $\Sg$ carries at least two strictly elliptic closed characteristics; moreover, $\Sg$ carries at least $2[\frac{n+2}{4}]$ non-hyperbolic closed characteristics.

entry.title: A geometric approach to Conn's linearization theorem
entry.summary: We give a soft geometric proof of the classical result due to Conn stating that a Poisson structure is linearizable around a singular point (zero) at which the isotropy Lie algebra is compact and semisimple.

entry.title: $C^0$-rigidity of characteristics in symplectic geometry
entry.summary: The paper concerns a $C^0$-rigidity result for the charcteristic foliations in symplectic geometry. A symplectic homeomorphism (in the sense of Eliashberg-Gromov) which preserves a smooth hypersurface also preserves its characteristic foliation.

entry.title: A Simple Proof of Unique Continuation for J-holomorphic Curves
entry.summary: In this expository paper, we prove strong unique continuation for J-holomorphic curves by first giving a simple proof of Aronszajn's theorem in the special case of the two-dimensional flat Laplacian.

entry.title: Generalized Weinstein tubular neighbourhood & Space of Lagrangian submersions
entry.summary: We present a generalized Weinstein Tubular Neighbourhood theorem for Lagrangian subbundles of Symplectic fibrations. This is then used to study the space of Lagrangian fibrations of symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: Floer Cohomology and Geometric Composition of Lagrangian Correspondences
entry.summary: We prove an isomorphism of Floer cohomologies under geometric composition of Lagrangian correspondences in exact and monotone settings.
entry.arxiv:comment: minor corrections, in particular more precise formulation of monotonicity assumptions

entry.title: Symplectic Birational Geometry
entry.summary: This is a survey on symplectic birational geometry. In arbitrary dimension, this subject is centered around the notion of uniruledness. In low dimensions, we will also discuss Kodaira dimension and minimality.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proc. of Yasha Fest

entry.title: Formal geometric quantization II
entry.summary: In this paper we pursue the study of formal geometric quantization of non-compact Hamiltonian manifolds. Our main result is the proof that two quantization process coincide. This fact was obtained by Ma and Zhang in the preprint arXiv:0812.3989 by completely different means.

entry.title: Categories of symplectic toric manifolds as Picard stack torsors
entry.summary: We outline a proof that the stack of symplectic toric G-manifolds over a fixed orbit space W is a torsor for the stack of symplectic toric G-principal bundles over W.

entry.title: Closed trajectories on symmetric convex Hamiltonian energy surfaces
entry.summary: In this article, let $\Sigma\subset\R^{2n}$ be a compact convex Hamiltonian energy surface which is symmetric with respect to the origin. where $n\ge 2$. We prove that there exist at least two geometrically distinct symmetric closed trajectories of the Reeb vector field on $\Sg$.

entry.title: A Homological Approach to Relative Knot Invariants
entry.summary: We define relative versions of the classical invariants of Legendrian and transverse knots in contact 3-manifolds for knots that are homologous to a fixed reference knot. We show these invariants are well-defined and give some basic properties.

entry.title: Relative Knot Invariants: Properties and Applications
entry.summary: We state Bennequin inequalities in the relative case, and show that the relative invariants are additive under relative connected sums. We show they exhibit similar limitations as their classical analogues. We study relatively Legendrian simple knots and give some classification results.

entry.title: First steps in the geography of scale Hilbert structures
entry.summary: Scale structures were introduced by H.Hofer, K.Wysocki, and E.Zehnder. In this note we define an invariant for scale Hilbert spaces modulo scale isomorphism and use it to distinguish large classes of scale Hilbert spaces.

entry.title: On a generalized Calabi-Yau equation
entry.summary: Dealing with the generalized Calabi-Yau equation proposed by Gromov on closed almost-K\"ahler manifolds, we extend to arbitrary dimension a non-existence result proved in complex dimension 2.

entry.title: Spin-quantization commutes with reduction
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove that the "quantization commutes with reduction" phenomenon of Guillemin-Sternberg applies in the context of the metaplectic correction.

entry.title: Fractal scale Hilbert spaces and scale Hessian operators
entry.summary: Scale spaces were defined by H.Hofer, K.Wysocki, and E.Zehnder. In this note we introduce a subclass of scale spaces and explain why we believe that this subclass is the right class for a general setup of Floer theory.

entry.title: Non-symplectic smooth circle actions on symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: We present some methods to construct smooth circle actions on symplectic manifolds with non-symplectic fixed point sets or non-symplectic cyclic isotropy point sets. All such actions are not compatible with any symplectic form.

entry.title: Introduction to the basics of Heegaard Floer homology
entry.summary: This paper provides an introduction to the basics of Heegaard Floer homology with some emphasis on the hat theory and to the contact geometric invariants in the theory. The exposition is designed to be comprehensible to people without any prior knowledge of the subject.

entry.title: On a theorem due to Birkhoff
entry.summary: The manifold M being compact and connected, we prove that every submanifold of its cotangent bundle that is Hamiltonianly isotopic to the zero-section and that is invariant by a Tonelli flow is a graph.

entry.title: Sutures and contact homology I
entry.summary: We define a relative version of contact homology for contact manifolds with convex boundary, and prove basic properties of this relative contact homology. Similar considerations also hold for embedded contact homology.

entry.title: On the algebraic independence of Hamiltonian characteristic classes
entry.summary: We prove that Hamiltonian characteristic classes defined as fibre integrals of powers of the coupling class are algebraically independent for generic coadjoint orbits.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: J. Symp. Geom. Volume 9, Issue 1 (2011), pp. 1--10

entry.title: Conley Conjecture for Negative Monotone Symplectic Manifolds
entry.summary: We prove the Conley conjecture for negative monotone, closed symplectic manifolds, i.e., the existence of infinitely many periodic orbits for Hamiltonian diffeomorphisms of such manifolds.

entry.title: Symplectic generic complex structures on 4-manifolds with b_+ = 1
entry.summary: We study symplectic structures on K\"ahler surfaces with p_g = 0. We give an example of a projective surface which admits a symplectic structure which is not compatible with any K\"ahler metric.

entry.title: Stable Hamiltonian structures in dimension three are supported by open books
entry.summary: We prove that every stable Hamiltonian structure on a closed oriented three-manifold is stably homotopic to one which is supported (with suitable signs) by an open book.

entry.title: Sharpness of Zapolsky inequality for quasi-states and Poisson brackets
entry.summary: Zapolsky inequality gives a lower bound for the L1 norm of the Poisson bracket of a pair of C1 functions on the two-dimensional sphere by means of quasi-states. Here we show that this lower bound is sharp.

entry.title: Gromov Witten invariants of exploded manifolds
entry.summary: This paper describes the structure of the moduli space of holomorphic curves and constructs Gromov Witten invariants in the category of exploded manifolds. This includes defining Gromov Witten invariants relative to normal crossing divisors and proving the associated gluing theorem which involves summing relative invariants over a count of tropical curves.

entry.title: Hofer's distance on diameters and the Maslov index
entry.summary: We prove that Hofer's distance between two diameters of the open 2-disk admits an upper bound in terms of the Maslov index of their intersection points.

entry.title: Smooth normal forms for integrable hamiltonian systems near a focus-focus singularity
entry.summary: We prove that completely integrable systems are normalisable in the C infinity category near focus-focus singularities.

entry.title: On exotic monotone Lagrangian tori in $\mathbb{C}P^2$ and $S^2 \times S^2$
entry.summary: In this note, we prove that two constructions of exotic monotone Lagrangian tori, namely the one by Chekanov and Schlenk and the one obtained by the circle bundle construction of Biran are Hamiltonian isotopic in $\mathbb{C}P^2$ and $S^2 \times S^2$.

entry.title: RAAGs in Ham
entry.summary: We prove that every RAAG (a Right-Angled Artin Group) embeds in the group of Hamiltonian symplectomorphisms of the 2-sphere.

entry.title: Floer homology of Lagrangian submanifolds
entry.summary: This is a translation of an article appeared in Japanese in Suugaku 63 (2011), no. 1, 43-66 (MR2790665) and is a survey of Lagrangian Floer homology which the author studies jointly with Y.-G.Oh, H. Ohta, and K. Ono. It also contains some explanation on its relation to (homological) mirror symmetry.

entry.title: Sheaves on P^1 x P^1, bigraded resolutions, and coadjoint orbits of loop groups
entry.summary: We construct a canonical linear resolution of acyclic 1-dimensional sheaves on P^1 x P^1 and discuss the resulting natural Poisson structure.

entry.title: On vector fields having properties of Reeb fields
entry.summary: We study constructions of vector fields with properties which are characteristic to Reeb vector fields of contact forms. In particular, we prove that all closed oriented odd-dimensional manifold have geodesible vector fields.

entry.title: Geography of symplectic 4- and 6-manifolds
entry.summary: The geography of minimal symplectic 4-manifolds with arbitrary fundamental group and symplectic 6-manifolds with abelian fundamental group of small rank, and with arbitrary fundamental group are addressed.

entry.title: Abstract analogues of flux as symplectic invariants
entry.summary: We study families of objects in Fukaya categories, specifically ones whose deformation behaviour is prescribed by the choice of an odd degree cohomology class. This leads to invariants of symplectic manifolds, which we apply to blowups along symplectic mapping tori.

entry.title: Relative orbifold Gromov-Witten theory and degeneration formula
entry.summary: Relative orbifold Gromov-Witten theory is set-up and the degeneration formula is given.

entry.title: Equivariant local index
entry.summary: This is an expository article on the equivariant local index developed by Fujita, Furuta, and the author in arXiv:1008.5007.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 1 figure. To appear in RIMS Kokyuroku Bessatsu

entry.title: Quantization commutes with reduction in the non-compact setting: the case of holomorphic discrete series
entry.summary: In this paper we show that the multiplicities of holomorphic discrete series representations relatively to reductive subgroups satisfy the credo "Quantization commutes with reduction".

entry.title: Joint quantum measurements and Poisson bracket invariants
entry.summary: The paper has been withdrawn by the author.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author. Generalized and incorporated into "Symplectic geometry of quantum noise"

entry.title: Dihedral homology and the moon
entry.summary: The equivariant homology of a twisted action of the orthogonal group on the free loop space of spheres was computed by Lodder via dihedral homology. In this note we explain how this twisted action appears in the restricted three body problem after Moser regularization.

entry.title: The Viterbo-Maslov Index in Dimension Two
entry.summary: We prove a formula that expresses the Viterbo-Maslov index of a smooth strip in an oriented 2-manifold with boundary curves contained in 1-dimensional submanifolds in terms the degree function on the complement of the union of the two submanifolds.

entry.title: Local GW Invariants of Elliptic Multiple Fibers
entry.summary: We use simple geometric arguments to calculate the dimension zero local Gromov-Witten invariants of elliptic multiple fibers. This completes the calculation of all dimension zero GW invariants of elliptic surfaces with $p_g>0$.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in Pure Appl. Math. Q

entry.title: Degree three spin Hurwitz numbers
entry.summary: Recently, Gunningham \cite{G} calculated all spin Hurwitz numbers in terms of combinatorics of Sergeev algebra. In this paper, we use a spin curve degeneration to obtain a recursion formula for degree three spin Hurwitz numbers.
entry.arxiv:comment: typos fixed, references added, motivation and comment on higher degree cases added

entry.title: Groupoids and Poisson sigma models with boundary
entry.summary: This note gives an overview on the construction of symplectic groupoids as reduced phase spaces of Poisson sigma models and its generalization in the infinite dimensional setting (before reduction).

entry.title: Bohr-Sommerfeld-Heisenberg Quantization of the 2-dimensional Harmonic Oscillator
entry.summary: We study geometric quantization of the harmonic oscillator in terms of a singular real polarization given by fibres of the energy momentum map.

entry.title: Poisson Algebras of Admissible Functions Associated to Twisted Dirac Structures
entry.summary: We define algebras of admissible functions associated to twisted Dirac structures, and we show that they are Poisson algebras. We study the standard cases associated to Dirac structures defined by graphs of non-degenerate 2-forms.

entry.title: A note on C^0 rigidity of Hamiltonian isotopies
entry.summary: We show that a symplectic isotopy that is a $C^0$ limit of Hamiltonian isotopies is itself Hamiltonian, if the corresponding sequence of generating Hamiltonians converge in $L^{(1, \infty)}$ topology.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, to appear in Journal of Symplectic Geometry

entry.title: A Γ-structure on Lagrangian Grassmannians
entry.summary: For n odd the Lagrangian Grassmannian of \R^{2n} is a \Gamma-manifold.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages; v2: new coauthor, nicer proof

entry.title: Symplectic periodic flows with exactly three equilibrium points
entry.summary: Let the circle act symplectically on a compact, connected symplectic manifold $M$. If there are exactly three fixed points, $M$ is equivariantly symplectomorphic to $\mathbb{CP}^2$.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: text overlap with arXiv:1003.4787 by other authors

entry.title: Recursion Operators and Frobenius Manifolds
entry.summary: In this note I exhibit a "discrete homotopy" which joins the category of F-manifolds to the category of Poisson-Nijenhuis manifolds, passing through the category of Frobenius manifolds.

entry.title: The fundamental group of the space of contact structures on the 3-torus
entry.summary: We show that the fundamental group of the space of contact structures on the 3-torus (based at the standard contact structure) is isomorphic to the integers.

entry.title: Smooth versus symplectic circle actions
entry.summary: We construct a 6-manifold M which admits a smooth circle action and a symplectic form w such that if w' is another symplectic form on M equivalent to w, then (M,w') does not admit a symplectic circle action.

entry.title: Seidel Representations and Quantum Cohomology of Toric Orbifolds
entry.summary: We use Seidel representation for symplectic orbifolds constructed in Tseng and Wang to compute the quantum cohomology ring of a compact symplectic toric orbifold $(\X,\omega)$.

entry.title: Geometry of Maslov cycles
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of induced Maslov cycle, which describes and unifies geometrical and topological invariants of many apparently unrelated problems, from Real Algebraic Geometry to sub-Riemannian Geometry.

entry.title: Symplectic $U_7$, $U_8$ and $U_9$ singularities
entry.summary: We use the method of algebraic restrictions to classify symplectic $U_7$, $U_8$ and $U_9$ singularities. We use discrete symplectic invariants to distinguish symplectic singularities of the curves. We also give the geometric description of symplectic classes.
entry.arxiv:comment: arXiv admin note: substantial text overlap with arXiv:1202.1124, arXiv:1001.3351, arXiv:1101.5176, arXiv:0805.4569

entry.title: Errata to 'A cylindrical reformulation of Heegaard Floer homology'
entry.summary: This note corrects one serious mistake and several smaller mistakes from arXiv:math/0502404. The main results of that paper are unchanged.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 5 figures. If you know other mistakes, please tell me

entry.title: Sharp symplectic embeddings of cylinders
entry.summary: We show that the cylinder Z^{2n}(1):= B^2(1)\times \mathbb{R}^{2(n-1)} embeds symplectically into B^4(R) \times \mathbb{R}^{2(n-2)} if R \geq \sqrt{3}.
entry.arxiv:comment: Originally part of version 2 of arXiv:1210.1537

entry.title: Closed exact Lagrangians in the symplectization of contact manifolds
entry.summary: For a certain class of exotic contact manifolds of dimension greater than 3, we show that there is an abundance of closed exact Lagrangians in their symplectization. All of these Lagrangians are displaceable by Hamiltonian isotopy, and many of the examples are nulhomotopic.

entry.title: Transversalité quantitative en géométrie symplectique : sous-variétés et hypersurfaces
entry.summary: Le th\'eor\`eme principal de cet article est un r\'esultat de transversalit\'e quantitative relatif \`a une sous-vari\'et\'e. The main theorem of this paper is a result of estimated transversality with respect to a given submanifold.

entry.title: Integral counts of pseudo-holomorphic curves
entry.summary: In \cite{FOinteger}, Fukaya and Ono outlined a way of counting pseudo-holomorphic curves in a general compact symplectic manifold to obtain integer valued invariants. This paper contains the details of Fukaya and Ono's suggested construction for any compact symplectic manifold and a large class of exploded manifolds.

entry.title: Unboundedness of the Lagrangian Hofer distance in the Euclidean ball
entry.summary: Let L denote the space of Lagrangians Hamiltonian isotopic to the standard Lagrangian in the unit ball in Euclidean space. We prove that the Lagrangian Hofer distance on L is unbounded.

entry.title: On the Action of Reparametrization Group on the Space of $L_k^p$-maps I
entry.summary: We prove that the action of reparametrization group on the space of $L_k^p$-maps is proper, which is defined in this paper.

entry.title: The equivariant local index of the reduced space in the symplectic cutting
entry.summary: We compute the equivariant local index for the reduced space in a symplectic cut space, provided that the reduced space is compact.

entry.title: The relative Gel'fand-Kalinin-Fuks cohomology groups of the formal Hamiltonian vector fields on 6-dimensional plane
entry.summary: Using Crystal basis theory, we study the relative Gel'fand-Kalinin-Fuks cohomology groups of the formal Hamiltonian vector fields on 6-dimensional plane with weight =2,4,6.

entry.title: On the non-existence of small positive loops of contactomorphisms on overtwisted contact manifolds
entry.summary: We prove that on overtwisted contact manifolds there can be no positive loops of contactomorphisms that are generated by a $C^0$-small Hamiltonian function.

entry.title: The multiplicities of the equivariant index of twisted Dirac operators
entry.summary: In this note, we give a geometric expression for the multiplicities of the equivariant index of a Dirac operator twisted by a line bundle.

entry.title: A class of new bi-invariant metrics on the Hamiltonian diffeomorphism groups
entry.summary: In this paper, we construct infinitely many bi-invariant metrics on the Hamiltonian diffeomorphism group and study their basic properties and corresponding generalizations of the Hofer inequality and Sikorav one.

entry.title: A note on the Gunningham's formula
entry.summary: Gunningham [G] constructed an extended topological quantum field theory (TQFT) to obtain a closed formula for all spin Hurwitz numbers. In this note, we use the gluing theorem in [LP2] to reprove the Gunningham's formula. We also describe a TQFT formalism naturally induced from the gluing theorem.

entry.title: The Weinstein conjecture for connected sums
entry.summary: We prove the Weinstein conjecture for non-trivial contact connected sums under either of two topological conditions: non-trivial fundamental group or torsion-free homology.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Int. Math. Res. Not. IMRN 2016, no. 2, 325-342

entry.title: Symplectic Connections on Supermanifolds: Existence and Non-Uniqueness
entry.summary: We show, in this note, that on any symplectic supermanifold, even or odd, there exist an infinite dimensional affine space of symmetric connections, compatible to the symplectic form.

entry.title: Some optimal embeddings of symplectic ellipsoids
entry.summary: We construct symplectic embeddings of ellipsoids of dimension $2n \ge 6$ into the product of a 4-ball or 4-dimensional cube with Euclidean space. A sequence of these embeddings can be shown to be optimal.

entry.title: Fukaya's work on Lagrangian embeddings
entry.summary: This is an expository account of some applications of string topology to the study of Lagrangian embeddings into symplectic manifolds, originally due to Fukaya, which was written as a contribution to a book on free loop spaces.

entry.title: Pseudoholomorphic quilts with figure eight singularity
entry.summary: We show that the novel figure eight singularity in a pseudoholomorphic quilt can be continuously removed when composition of Lagrangian correspondences is cleanly immersed. The proof of this result requires a collection of width-independent elliptic estimates that allow for non-standard complex structures on the domain.

entry.title: Symplectic Mackey Theory
entry.summary: Many years ago Kazhdan, Kostant and Sternberg defined the notion of inducing a hamiltonian action from a Lie subgroup. In this paper, we develop the attendant imprimitivity theorem and Mackey analysis in the full generality needed to deal with arbitrary closed normal subgroups.

entry.title: Enlacements asymptotiques revisités
entry.summary: We give an alternative proof of a theorem of Gambaudo-Ghys and Fathi on the interpretation of the Calabi homomorphism for the standard symplectic disc as an average rotation number. This proof uses only basic complex analysis.

entry.title: Floer homology on the time-energy extended phase space
entry.summary: We show how Rabinowitz Floer homology can be seen as a standard Floer homology for fixed period Hamiltonian orbits on an extended phase space.

entry.title: On Legendrian foliations in contact manifolds II: Deformation theory
entry.summary: Using the structural theorems developed in [Hua13], we study the deformation theory of coisotropic submanifolds in contact manifolds, under the assumption that the characteristic foliation is nonsingular. In the "middle" dimensions, we find an interesting relationship with foliation theory. Some elementary applications of contact geometry in foliation theory are explored.

entry.title: My Contact Homology Shopping List
entry.summary: We list the properties of contact homology, beyond purely formal, needed for the proofs of some of the recent applications of contact homology in dynamics to work. The list is put together for the AIM Transversality in Contact Homology Workshop.

entry.title: Lagrangian product tori in tame symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: Product Lagrangian tori in standard symplectic space $R^{2n}$ were classified up to symplectomorphism in [Che96]. We extend this classification to tame symplectically aspherical symplectic manifolds. We show by examples that the asphericity assumption cannot be omitted.

entry.title: Intersection Cohomology of the Universal Imploded Cross-Section of SU(3)
entry.summary: We compute the intersection cohomology of the universal imploded cross-section of SU(3), and show that it is different from the intersection cohomology of a point.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Pure and Applied Mathematics Quarterly, Volume 10, Number 4, 1-9, 2014

entry.title: Automorphisms of Quadratic Liouville Structures
entry.summary: We examine the diffeomorphisms of a symplectic vector space that preserve a chosen symplectic potential. Our examination yields an explicit description of these diffeomorphisms when the chosen potential differs from the canonical potential by the differential of a homogeneous quadratic in one of three broad classes.

entry.title: Symplectic displacement energy for exact Lagrangian immersions
entry.summary: We give an inequality of the displacement energy for exact Lagrangian immersions and the symplectic area of punctured holomorphic discs. Our approach is based on Floer homology for Lagrangian immersions and Chekanov's homotopy technique of continuations.

entry.title: Folded Symplectic Toric Four-Manifolds
entry.summary: We show that two orientable, four-dimensional folded symplectic toric manifolds are isomorphic provided that their orbit spaces have trivial degree-two integral cohomology and there exists a diffeomorphism of the orbit spaces (as manifolds with corners) preserving orbital moment maps.

entry.title: On the Gromov width of homogeneous Kaehler manifolds
entry.summary: We compute the Gromov width of homogeneous Kaehler manifolds with second Betti number equal to one. Our result is based on the recent preprint [4] and on the upper bound of the Gromov width for such manifolds obtained in [6].

entry.title: Contact homology and virtual fundamental cycles
entry.summary: We give a construction of contact homology in the sense of Eliashberg--Givental--Hofer. Specifically, we construct coherent virtual fundamental cycles on the relevant compactified moduli spaces of pseudo-holomorphic curves.

entry.title: Hamiltonian unknottedness of certain monotone Lagrangian tori in $S^2\times S^2$
entry.summary: We prove that a monotone Lagrangian torus in $S^2\times S^2$ which suitably sits in a symplectic fibration with two sections in its complement is Hamiltonian isotopic to the Clifford torus.

entry.title: On Stability of Nodal $L_k^p$-Maps I
entry.summary: We give a general definition of weakly stable nodal $L_k^p$-maps as a natural generalization of the stability for $J$-holomorphic nodal maps in GW theory. A complete characterization of the weakly stable nodal $L_k^p$-maps are given in term of their isotropy groups.

entry.title: Note on a theorem of Bangert
entry.summary: We generalize Bangert's non-hyperbolicity result for uniformly tamed almost complex structures on standard symplectic $R^{2n}$ to asymtotically standard symplectic manifolds.

entry.title: On The Augmentation Categories of Positive Braid Closures
entry.summary: In this paper we show that 0-resolution of a crossing in the Legendrian closure of a positive braid induces a cohomologically faithful $A_\infty$ functor on augmentation categories. In particular, we compute the bilinearized Legendrian contact cohomology of these knots for augmentations induced by 0-resolution.

entry.title: Partitions of the set of natural numbers and symplectic homology
entry.summary: We prove Tamura's theorem on partitions of the set of positive integers (a generalization of the more famous Rayleigh-Beatty theorem) using the positive $\mathbb{S}^1$-equivariant symplectic homology.

entry.title: The projective symplectic geometry of higher order variational problems: minimality conditions
entry.summary: We associate curves of isotropic, Lagrangian and coisotropic subspaces to higher order, one parameter variational problems. Minimality and conjugacy properties of extremals are described in terms of these curves.

entry.title: Symplectic log Calabi-Yau surface---deformation class
entry.summary: We study the symplectic analogue of log Calabi-Yau surfaces and show that the symplectic deformation classes of these surfaces are completely determined by the homological information.

entry.title: A Seifert-van Kampen Theorem for Legendrian Submanifolds and Exact Lagrangian Cobordisms
entry.summary: We prove a Seifert-van Kampen theorem for Legendrian submanifolds and exact Lagrangian cobordisms, and use it to calculate the change in the DGA caused by critical Legendrian ambient surgery.

entry.title: Kodaira Dimension in Low Dimensional Topology
entry.summary: This is a survey on the various notions of Kodaira dimension in low dimensional topology. The focus is on progress after the 2006 survey [78].
entry.arxiv:comment: It is to appear in the Proceedings of Tsinghua-Sanya International Mathematics Forum

entry.title: On the complement of a positive normal crossing divisor with no triple intersection in a projective variety
entry.summary: We describe how the Weinstein structure of the complement is modified when a positive divisor degenerates to a normal crossing divisor with no triple intersection.

entry.title: Chekanov-type theorem for spherized cotangent bundles
entry.summary: We prove a Chekanov-type theorem for the spherization of the cotangent bundle $ST^*B$ of a closed manifold $B$. It claims that for Legendrian submanifolds in $ST^*B$ the property "to be given by a generating family quadratic at infinity" persists under Legendrian isotopies.

entry.title: Classical and quantum spherical pendulum
entry.summary: This paper extends the Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization of the spherical pendulum to a full quantum theory. This the first application of geometric quantization to a classical system with monodromy.

entry.title: Simple Homotopy Equivalence of Nearby Lagrangians
entry.summary: Given a closed exact Lagrangian in the cotangent bundle of a closed smooth manifold, we prove that the projection to the base is a simple homotopy equivalence.

entry.title: The three cusps conjecture
entry.summary: We prove Arnol'd's three cusps conjecture about the front of Legendrian curves in the projectivized cotangent bundle of the $2$-sphere. We use the microlocal theory of sheaves of Kashiwara and Schapira and study the derived category of sheaves on the $2$-sphere with a given smooth Lagrangian microsupport.

entry.title: Poisson cohomology of a class of log symplectic manifolds
entry.summary: We compute the Poisson cohomology of a class of Poisson manifolds that are symplectic away from a collection $D$ of hypersurfaces. These Poisson structures induce a generalization of symplectic and cosymplectic structures, which we call a k-cosymplectic structure, on the intersection of hypersurfaces in $D$.

entry.title: The conjugation method in symplectic dynamics
entry.summary: We prove the existence of minimal symplectomorphisms and strictly ergodic contactomorphisms on manifolds which admit a locally free $\mathbb{S}^1$--action by symplectomorphisms and contactomorphisms, respectively. The proof adapts the conjugation method, introduced by Anosov and Katok, to the contact and symplectic setting.

entry.title: Nonrational Symplectic Toric Cuts
entry.summary: In this article we extend cutting and blowing up to the nonrational symplectic toric setting. This entails the possibility of cutting and blowing up for symplectic toric manifolds and orbifolds in nonrational directions.

entry.title: Simplices in Newton-Okounkov bodies and the Gromov width of coadjoint orbits
entry.summary: We give a uniform proof for the conjectured Gromov width of coadjoint orbits of all compact connected simple Lie groups, by analyzing simplices in Newton-Okounkov bodies.

entry.title: Categorical localization for the coherent-constructible correspondence
entry.summary: We prove a microlocal counterpart of categorical localization for Fukaya categories in the setting of the coherent-constructible correspondence.

entry.title: A simplicial construction of G-equivariant Floer homology
